abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First Transport Project
            for Poland were as follows: outcomes were highly
            satisfactory, Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: creation of the specialized unit for
            procurement within the railway, headed by someone with
            international procurement experience, and the retention of
            that specialist throughout implementation, was an immense
            help. Continuity of task manager from the preparation phase
            through implementation yields considerable benefits in terms
            of the efficiency and consistency of the Bank's role. A
            broad initial project in a sector can prove valuable in
            opening the door for subsequent lending operations which
            then pursue in more detail and in narrower fields the
            institutional band policy reforms analyzed under the first operation.

abstracts.cdata!:
The First Transport Project will help
            the Government implement improved institutional structures
            and management techniques for the transport sector.  There
            are five project objectives : 1) support the
            Government's efforts to restructure the transport
            sector; 2) introduce more efficient internal management
            systems and maintenance procedures; 3) train managers in
            modern management techniques; 4) increase competition in the
            transport sector; and 5) improve the economic, financial and
            operating performance of the state railways.  The project
            comprises four main components : a) repair and modernization
            of equipment and facilities for railway rolling stock, track
            maintenance and signaling and telecommunications; b)
            measurement and laboratory equipment for maintenance and
            repair of the highway network; c) technical assistance to
            introduce an improved management information system ( MIS )
            and to investigate long term strategic issues in the sector;
            and d) training for senior managers of sector institutions.
